definition: to get panicky/to lose one's head/(coll.) (after 得) unbearably/terribly
Kangxi radical 61 (心) as a vertical side element
in a great rush/in a flurry
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
calm and unhurried (idiom); composed/to take matters calmly

sentences.english: Mr. Wei panic, and he suspected grandson swallowed another cell.
sentences.chinese: 魏先生慌了，他怀疑是孙子吞了另一节电池。

sentences.english: Calm down, little Kory. Let's try to find your way home together.
sentences.chinese: 不要慌，小柯利，我们一起找回家的路。

sentences.english: Exams don't turn over a book, absolutely pigs, cheating don't panic, caught is loaded.
sentences.chinese: 考试不翻书，简直头猪，作弊不要慌，逮到就要装。

sentences.english: Only I got so bored, I just thought I'd treat myself to a visit to town.
sentences.chinese: 只是我觉得烦得慌，所以想到镇上来转转。

sentences.english: Trials may come, yet I'll not fear.
Do not fear the helm, the boat secure.
sentences.chinese: 把舵的不慌，乘船的稳当。

sentences.english: If we were to panic , we could not be able to help .
sentences.chinese: 要是我们慌了，我们就不能帮忙了。

sentences.english: ChenYan very worried, feel all up, want to run road a time.
sentences.chinese: 陈妍很慌，觉得自己彻底完了，要先跑路一阵时间。

sentences.english: The whole class panicked when the teacher said that there would be a quiz today.
sentences.chinese: 当老师说今天要小考时，全班都慌了。

sentences.english: Other kids panicked, cried shouted, and some run to adults.
sentences.chinese: 别的小朋友都慌了，叫着喊着，有的跑去找大人。

sentences.english: I panicked and told my husband that we needed to hide the body.
sentences.chinese: 我很慌，告诉我丈夫我们得把尸体藏起来。

sentences.english: The rabbit is very dead and the guy panics.
sentences.chinese: 兔子已经死翘了，那哥们自然是怕得慌。

sentences.english: She had scraped together enough money for college.
sentences.chinese: 我积攒的钱可使我遇难不慌。

sentences.english: Occasionally heard the sound or owl howl, that sounds so infiltration.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔传来一两声猫头鹰的啸叫，听起来怪渗得慌。

sentences.english: Kept at home with a wounded leg, I began to feel cooped up.
sentences.chinese: 我因为脚受了伤而被迫呆在家里，感到闷的慌。

definition: to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
